habitat_description:
Populations of this species are found in Florida and Georgia. In Georgia, the range extends into the Withlacoochee and Alapaha rivers, and the Suwannee River drainage (Jensen 1998). In northern Florida, the density was estimated at approximately 305 adult females in an area of 5 Km (41 ha) of river (Jackson and Walker 1997; Natureserve.org).

River cooters are highly aquatic (Mount 1975) They are found throughout the southeast chiefly in streams with moderate current, abundant aquatic vegetation, basking sites, and rocky bottom; also larger lakes, ponds, oxbows, swamps, ditches, lagoons, and brackish tidal marshes in Gulf of Mexico; leaves water only to nest or bask (Ernst and Barbour 1972, in NatureServe 2005). They nest on sandy or friable soils usually less than 30 m from water (Ernst et al. 1994). Amy Silvano 7jul05
